name: Susan Norrie
biography:
Susan Norrie has been working in painting, installation and still photography for more than twenty years.  Since the mid 1990s, she has explored natural and man-made disasters as a metaphor for humanity under crisis. Norrie has been the artist in residence at the University of Melbourne, and at ZKM, Karlsruhe, Germany.  Over the last two decades Norrie has exhibited in solo exhibitions worldwide and group shows at Sydney Biennale 1996 and 2004; Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, New York; The National Museum of Contemporary Art, Seoul; Liverpool Biennial 2000; Kiasma, Helsinki; and the Hamburger Bahnof, Berlin.
(SW 30.03.05)
